units.title: Crypt isolation and organoid culture
units.text:
Crypt isolation and organoid culture
Tissues were transferred into Dulbecco’s phosphate-buffered saline (DPBS) and placed on ice until processing. Crypt isolation was performed as previously reported45 with modifications. Briefly, tissues were washed with DPBS to remove debris. The tissues were treated with 2.5 mM EDTA at 4 °C for 40 minutes to release crypts. The supernatant containing crypts was collected and embedded in Cultrex RGF BME (R&D Systems) droplets in 48-well plates (~50 crypts/well). After solidification, droplets were overlaid with culture medium containing 10 μM Y-27632 (TargetMol). The medium was changed every 3 days.
units.rationale: Describes the step‑by‑step procedure for isolating intestinal crypts and establishing organoid cultures.

units.title: Manual picking, expansion, and genotyping of organoid colonies
units.text:
Organoid colonies derived from single cells were manually picked, expanded, and genotyped.
Organoids were randomly taken from whole wells without being segmented and dissociated from the BME with TrypLE and dissociated into single cells. Cells were washed with ice-cold DPBS and filtered into FACS tubes through a 40 μm cell strainer (Falcon). Cells were stained with Hoechst (Beyotime) to identify live cells before FACS analysis. units.rationale: Provides a concise actionable protocol for isolating single‑cell‑derived colonies and preparing them for downstream analysis.

units.title: Quantitative PCR (qPCR) of gene expression
units.text: qPCR was performed using the ChamQ Universal SYBR qPCR Master Mix (Vazyme) on a CFX384 Real-Time System (BioRad).
units.rationale: Specifies the reagents and instrument used for measuring transcript levels, constituting a complete qPCR protocol step.

units.title: Organoid dissociation and re‑embedding for passaging
units.text: Established organoids were dissociated into single cells with TrypLE (Gibco) and re-embedded in fresh BME at a density of approximately 8000 cells per well, in a total volume of 20 μL, within a 48-well plate.
units.rationale: Outlines the method for breaking down mature organoids into single cells and reseeding them for continued culture.
